comment.body: 记得住的只有 4chan 这个
You can download its source at the official site, but the development is closed, they do not accept patches from outside the company.
@Quantumworld: I am using Firefox. It is evil, but less evil than Chrome.

@Quantumworld: Technically we do not need a browser. Most part of www belongs two categories: 1) web pages displaying some context 2) some frontend UI to read/write some json data. For 1, we can access them with text browsers such as lynx or w3m (some fancy web pages requires JavaScript to display the content, but usually we can fetch some search engine's cached copy instead); for 2, we can read/write the data manually from their open or undocumented API in most programming languages. But that is very inconvenient.

@Quantumworld: Web is dying. In US there will be Facebook, Google, Amazon, Apple, Microsoft, Netflix, Twitter, and rounding errors. In other countries, some names may be replaced by other names, but the essence is the same.
There are unofficial builds for Linux 32-bit: https://github.com/nodejs/unofficial-builds/
